Title: A quiet, relaxing location.
Text:
We enjoyed our stay here, it was the end of our holiday and all we wanted to do was lie by the pool and relax and this was a great place to do it.
The hotel is very remote so you will need a car if you want to go to the local towns.
The pool is amazing with a great bar. There is a great selection of food and drinks available to eat around the pool. 
Our room was lovely with a great outdoor area.
The hotel restaurant had lovely food but the selection was very limited. The bar was really quiet with a big selection of drinks.

Title: Wonderful, relaxed haven
Text:
My wife and I stayed for 4 nights in August with our 10 month old baby. We could not have been better treated by everyone in the hotel. From the moment we arrived to the time we left, we were made to feel welcome so we easily relaxed into our stay. 

We had a standard king room  - the bed was huge and room easily big enough for the three of us and all the gear a new baby needs. 

The breakfast was great - good coffee, omelettes, cold meats and cheese, cereal, fruit and even the pastries were great (often a rare thing in hotels in my experience) 

We loved the bar by the "pool" perfect for an evening Aperol Spritz and ate twice in the restaurant. The restaurant is a great spot overlooking a gorgeous garden. 

We were in the area to visit family so only managed one day by the pool but it was a highlight of our trip. Again we were well looked after by the pool staff and were able to relax in the shade with our baby for ferragosto

I'd highly recommend the hotel, it's spacious without being overwhelming. it's a beautiful spot and the staff are fantastic. The service is attentive and friendly without being overbearing. 

We can't wait to go back.

Title: You’re in for a lovely stay.
Text:
Absolutely wonderful!  
Beautiful, clean, terrific service.
The bar service and restaurant service is classy.
The food at the restaurant was consistly good - chicken cutlets in lemon sauce, perfectly cooked steak over salad, French Fries (who knew), tiramisu 
on a delicious cookie, and excellent wine.  
Thank you for the experience.

Title: Fabulous!! A wonderful place!!
Text:
We spent time here just by chance. It turned out to be one of the highlights of our trip. The facility was gorgeous…huge, green, beautifully maintained!!  Our rooms were lovely with balconies looking out over the property.  After long days of sightseeing it was wonderful to return to eat at their wonderful restaurant.  David, and Mauritzio  treated us like dear friends.  Marta at the front couldn’t have been sweeter
Tenuta Moreno has it all….so glad we found it

Title: one of the best location for your special events
Text: This resort offer you all the services you need to enjoy your vacation time or work-meeting.. Good place, swimming pool, good food, all the best that this part of Apulian Region can offer you. Big space for convention, excellent services

Title: Puglia + hotel where weddings are celebrated  =  fantastic spot !
Text:
Dream house, gardens, swimming pool and surroundings, beautiful rooms, quality local cooking.
Perfect location for a chill - or not - long stay.

An amazing space, so the sharing between « holiday travellers » and wedding guests is not disturbing, only leading to a few funny stategic talks  😉

11 nights juli-august. Great welcoming job in the restaurant from Davide and Pina, and at the pool from Claudia and the lifeguard.
Really everyone from the staff (all fields) is helpful, effective and friendly.

Nice experience to save in the favorites …

Title: Pleasant stay and perfect location
Text:
Lovely hotel and perfect location for visiting some of the important places around.
Very big swimming pool. Nice garden. Helpful staff at he reception for making restaurant reservations in Mesagne. You need to rent a car to have the best time in Puglia in combination with this hotel. Only the restaurant prices are to high if you compare with all the nice restaurants in Mesagne.

Title: Fantastic
Text: The hotel is amazing. Room is very large with balcony listen to thousand of birds singing in the morning and evening. The hotel is in the middle of a farm where they produce all their foods. The swimming is clean and big  and all the staff is really kind.

Title: lovely place to spend the day ,
Text: if you need to share a swimming pool. Nice pool, grass to sit on, comfortable and enough sun beds. Reasonably safe for small children but they need watching. The food available was perfectly reasonable, and there were no queues on any of the four times we went. Not cheap but worth it.

Title: Comfortable but a bit cold
Text:
Lovely, well maintained, expansive grounds dotted with ancient olive trees throughout. The hotel has a large lobby with various comfortable seating areas.
Rooms are very spacious and comfortable with a separate sitting area as well as an outdoor private terrace with additional seating.
Water bottles in the room are not complimentary and charged at an excessive Eur 3 per bottle. At that price, you’re better off stopping by a supermarket prior to reaching Tenuta Moreno and buying your own water bottles.
Breakfast buffet is extensive, varied, and tasty. The eggs were especially fresh. Outdoor seating is lovely while the indoor dining area near the buffet is devoid of all charm.

Title: Amazing stay at the Tenuta
Text:
Me and my wife had a fantastic stay at the Tenuta Moreno; the place is beautifully located in the Alto Salento countryside, surrounded by olive trees and trulli. We enjoyed the warm weather sunbathing and swimming/chilling in the two pools (a larger one outside the hotel building and a smaller one, with pool bar, open-air but within the hotel building).
The room was a spacious, clean and well decorated double room. 
Recommended location for a relaxing holiday in Puglia.

Title: "Quiet location in beautiful surroundings"
Text:
Nice and beautiful located hotel with marvellously pool. Large room with: safe, minibar and the opportunity to prepare coffee or tea. Wonderful shower illuminated with blue light. Perfectly equipped sanitary facilities, hair dryer, bidet, 
Breakfast was ok, fresh fruit, different types of bread, freshly squeezed orange juice.
Room was clean only the smell of bleach was troubling me.
Various sports can be practised including archery. Spacious parking area.

Title: 11 days vacation stay :-)
Text:
First of all the hotel is nice located! It is easy to find via car and the hotel offers a lot of free parking spaces. The entrance area as well as the reception team is always welcoming you very nice! And I need to name one of the staff which did a very great job; it’s Marta! Always ready to support with a smile. The rooms are big and always very clean! The little balcony was very nice too. I was just missing some things:
Roomservice: A clear Menue in the room for small snack orders or a quick breakfast would be helpful for the staff as well as for the guests! I ordered several times the same but what I got was different sometimes! 
Restaurant: Very nice place to eat. The food was really great! But I was missing service with a smile. The guest came all at the same time, Sunday Dinner Menue, and all tables got the courses at the same time. I was ask at the beginning for drinks and then no more! When the plate was empty they took it and even not ask if all was ok, just from time to time! The head waiter seems a bit stressed! And one thing to add, I wanted to come for dinner but they just had fish in the Menue, the headwaiter told me no a la carte tonight! He was not even offering to check with the kitchen what is possible. For this hotel the kind of service needs to get improved! I ask at reception again, they tried to help, but due to communication we can not find a solution. So i Said i war outside and they said Ok. Not really professional. 
Spa: Very friendly and nice! I can really recommend to visit the team over there! Great massage and the spa is set up nice! 
Housekeeping: Very friendly and always on time. Thanks for the great work! Always very clean and supportive! 
Pool Area: Great To use. The bar was nice but no high standard! Food was ok, for easy snacks!

Title: Lovely hotel
Text:
Beautiful hotel in beautiful extensive grounds. Large comfortable rooms with enormous king beds. TV, kettle, safe, good amount of storage. Shower over bath, bidet. Air conditioning effective. We had a front facing balcony which was huge. Good breakfast choice. We took a cycle ride around the grounds and noticed they raise their own chickens, herbs, vegetables and even bee hives. The pool is a large outdoor one with a bar attached that serves pool snacks and gives out pool towels. There was a wedding whilst we were staying which looked absolutely beautiful as it was held outside.
Extensive parking, close to brindisi airport
beds are very hard, shower over bath could do with a shower screen as floor gets wet, wifi could be better.
25 minute drive to Torre Gauceto beach,

Title: Perfect place for relax and refresh
Text: Large hotel property has football, tennis, two swimming pools, spa, garden.  Room is big and comfortable. Shower room has three type of showers with blue lighting such as hand type, top rain shower and water falls like which is very unique.  Restaurant is very delicate and Keen to use locals and thier own grown with quite reasonable prices as hotel.  Gym has saunas. Breakfast is ecellent especially it has a squeeze orage machine to give a truly fresh juice.

Title: Amazing place
Text: This is a perfect place for events, high quality service and food. Also nice for a very exclusive dinner . The renewed typical buildings are beautiful , very huge garden with more then one swiingpool ... WOW factor

Title: Lovely hotel in a away from it all location
Text: I attended a conference and the accomodation and meals were looked after by the organisers. The rooms were of good quality but unfortunately the bathroom did not have an independent shower. The three meals we had in the hotel were of high standard and the swimming pool and adjoining facilities together with the  spa facilities were also excellent. Parking area is vast within the hotel grounds.

Title: Okay stay in a dated masseria
Text: The grounds of this property are absolutely beautiful - wide expanses to explore inside a grove of ancient olive trees. The breakfast buffet was lovely and the setting (we sat outside on the patio) was perfect. Fellow travelers, you will understand my lament when I explain that we, unfortunately, got grandma's room. Perhaps there are nice rooms here but ours was just kind of run down and odd - a bed so large a family of four could sleep, except the mattress was so hard they could not - plus two twin beds on the side. Maybe it's a good value but there are other masserias in Puglia that I really enjoyed more.

Title: Couldn't sleep two consecutive nights
Text:
I regret to say that this hotel does not deserve 4 stars. Actually I stayed there two nights and I could not sleep on both nights.

The main issue is the air conditioning system. It is water cooled, so every room has a machine inside the room in a false ceiling close to the entrance door and, when you turn it on, it's just like a vacuum cleaner working in the same room you're trying to sleep in. 
On the first night I talked to the concierge and he brought me to another room on the first floor: the noise was even louder, so I stayed in the hotel main room till 4:30 am. 
It is southern Italy, so it's hot in the summer, even at nights, so basically I had to choose between the vacuum cleaner and the hot summer air. 

There were other issues (i.e. door room not closing properly, had to pull it very strongly to get it closed) but none like the obsolete air conditioning system.

There are also good things (breakfast cakes for instance) but at the end of the day I would definitely not recommend this hotel.

Title: Wonderful full service hotel set in an olive orchard.
Text: The property is set in a large quiet location off the main road. The rooms are very up to date. Part of the property was an old farm house which has been converted into beautiful public rooms The staff is very friendly and helpful. There are two large pools on the property which are great to have on hot days. The restaurant and pool bar are quite good. Breakfast room is quite large with a large array of breakfast items for most everyone's liking. Great place for a wedding or large conference/business meeting.

Title: Beautiful holiday
Text: We stayed at Tenuta Moreno as part of a group. The highlights were the food, potager garden and pool. We went for a lovely meal in Mesange but mostly we   had meals at the hotel. The food was outstanding and great to try the specialty wine and food from the region. The pool was perfect and great to have the bar to order drinks and      snacks whilst at the pool. The rooms are large but fairly dated. Staff were very helpful.

Title: Una bellissima settimana soleggiata!
Text:
I could be quite brief about this place. To my standards, it's pretty close to perfection.

While the hotel may seem to be located in the middle of nowhere, it's very close to the Brindisi-Taranto highway and yet surprisingly peaceful. The buildings and grounds are gorgeous and very large. You can walk around them for an hour or more without getting bored. There is a huge pool, several beautiful gardens, an enormous parking lot (for our tiny rental car), and cute birds and lizards all over the place.

The room (127) was clean and spacious whith a small private terrace. Wi-fi coverage in the rooms and restaurant is not that great, but frankly we couldn't care less. We also couldn't quite figure out how to operate the A/C unit but still we managed to keep the room temperature at a steady 24 degrees C.

Hotel staff was very kind and helpful and the overall service was just great. They have free spa and wellness (which we didn't even try), free bicycles, free towels at the pool... There's a lovely bar outside the main building with a good selection of drinks and cocktails, and a small sunny pool bar.

But still I think the best thing of all is their restaurant. At the breakfast buffet, we found everything we needed to start the day. We stayed for seven nights on half board and they offered a brand new choice menu every night: antipasti buffet, five first and five main course choices, a small dessert buffet and a lovely selection of local wines. We Belgians love good food, and we were never disappointed.

Are you traveling to Puglia and thinking about staying at Tenuta Moreno? Just do it. You will not be disappointed, but if you are planning to stay for more than just a couple of days, get a rental car so you can explore the beautiful region.

Title: Fabulous hotel and staff but limited choice for food
Text: We arrived late for a 4 night stay, and had previously arranged cheese, fruit bread and wine which was waiting for us in our rooms. The rooms are spacious enough, with good bathrooms and a small balcony. There is free WIFI throughout the hotel. Breakfast is continental and served in the range grove. Very peaceful and a plentiful selection of fruit, ham, cheese, cereal, pastries, etc. Fresh orange from the juicing machine is not to be missed! The pool is spectacular and quiet, and there is a small bar serving drinks and sandwiches. The lunch selection at the bar was quite limited, though well presented. The hotel restaurant for dinner is quite expensive compared to the restaurants in Mesagne, and to be honest the food is not as good. The pasta was fine, but the beef dish was quite fatty and stringy. We only dined there once, preferring the smaller restaurants in Mesagne which is 10 minutes away in a car. The staff were fantastic from start to finish. Nothing was too much trouble for them. Overall a beautiful setting for a wonderful hotel, and maybe at the height of the season there would be more dining options.

Title: Gorgeous oasis of peace
Text: Really stunning hotel and grounds with a fabulous large pool that is never busy. Always plenty of loungers and large beanbags to relax on. Small bar for snacks. Large gardens to walk around. Friendly staff and a very Italian breakfast outside in the orange grove with fresh juicers lots of cakes and pastries, cheese meats and an egg station. Lovely outside bar and small pool area. Lots of weddings - almost daily. Very close to Mesagne which has a lovely old town centre to walk round. Nice restaurant in town called Osteria del Vicoletto. Worth visiting Ostuni and Lecce. Alberobello and Carovigno. Wouldn't stay here for longer than a week as it is in the middle of countryside. Do not attempt to find it without Sat Nav and even then you need to input the latitude and longitude otherwise you will end up down a dirt track in an olive grove.  Very convenient for Brindisi airport on about twenty minutes away. Would return here it is very relaxing and a stunningly converted 17th century building and staff very helpful. Only a few English people here and in the area in general.

Title: Doesn't fail to deliver time and time again
Text: Great place to stay. Fantastic swimming pool and service. Attended a wedding there as well. Fantastic setting. Love the olive groves and the orangery. A real gem in the puglia countryside. I would highly recommend this place!

Title: A good choice in a Beautiful Area
Text: This hotel has large  grounds and a very pretty setting. Rooms are nicely appointed and the staff is very friendly. Bed quality is excellent. The air-conditioning system seemed sub adequate despite it being not overly hot. Dinner at their restaurant was very good. Overall a good choice.

Title: Great hotel
Text: Had a lovely stay here. Great room and bathroom. Brilliant pool with a small bar to grab those important Peronis from. The food was very well cooked and enjoyable and they were very flexible given we ended up arriving later than planned. Recommended.

Title: Unforgettable!
Text:
My adult students and I spent a week at Tenuta Moreno and visited all magnificent towns such as Lecce,
Gallipoli, Otranto, Alberobello. Tenuta Moreno is a fantastic place.. All the staff were amazing! Food and wine absolutely delicious! Don't miss the opportunity to spend some time there!

Title: Loved our stay!
Text: My husband and I stayed here for one night and loved the beautiful hotel and grounds - we walked around and admired every inch of the lush well kept gardens and pools around the hotel.  Our room was large and comfortable and walked to an outside terrace which overlooked the grounds.  The pool was lovely - my husband swam but it was too cold for me.  We stayed here on our travels between towns and it seemed rather remote but not far from Mesagne.  The décor was lovely as was the breakfast and dinner.  We certainly recommend this lovely hotel.

Title: Beautiful property for a relaxing oasis
Text: After a 40-mile cycling trip from Lecce to this location, this was a perfect stop. Had a 35 massage and relaxed in the spa area, that was beyond blissful. The grounds are well-maintained, my room was spacious with a great patio for tea or coffee. Comfortable bed and peaceful. The restaurant was also fantastic. The location is not close to anything of real excitement that I could tell, so its perfect for a relaxing, quiet getaway or a stop on a cycling trip through Puglia.

Title: Fabulous Hotel set in wonderful grounds
Text: The hotel is an absolute gem set in wonderful gardens with a fantastic pool area. The architecture of the hotel is amazing and the restoration is sympathetic to its past history and beauty, in combining the new with the old. The customer service was exceptional and of the highest quality and attention to customer service, especially Mareta, and her colleagues on reception. Also Luigi and colleagues on poolside bar/hotel bar and restaurant were excellent. The food was of the highest order and quality. This was our second stay at the hotel and we will be returning on many further visits in the future.

Title: Wonderful place for a vacation
Text: This is a beautifully kept hotel in extensive grounds with a spectacular swimming pool. The staff are polite and efficient, the food excellent. The breakfast buffet deserves special mention - fruit and vegetable juices, local specialities, freshly cooked omelettes. The rooms are spacious, with balconies (the ones facing inwards have mosquito nets, much appreciated). The only problem is the wifi coverage (but this is not the hotel's fault). The facilities round the pool are excellent - loungers, large cushions, a bar with very pleasant staff.

Title: what a way to relax but get a car
Text:
Very nice hotel, really good pool area and very quiet. If you want to relax, this has to be one of the best places to do that.
Rooms are good but wi-fi access in the room is poor, the lobby is comfortable and large with good wi-fi.
It's very clean throughout and the staff are helpful. It also has a nice outside restaurant for breakfast and dinner with better than average food.
The poolside bar is nice with drinks and snacks and the staff are very friendly.
Drawbacks, dinner menu is very limited and theme nights take away choice but they do not give you another place to eat dinner, bar food would be useful in the evening.
There is nothing else to do in the area without a car, so if you want anything other than total relaxation, car hire is a must.

Title: Best customer service ever
Text: This place was truly beautiful! Hotel was set in the most wonderful grounds and every view was breath taking. My husband and were so impressed by the food- we only needed the first course most nights- and as my husband is a chef that a big compliment! The staff could not do more for us and were so helpful- went above and beyond what we could have asked for! We will be visiting again for sure!

Title: Wonderful birthday party
Text:
We were  back to our favourite hotel to celebrate my husband's birthday. Family and friends flew in from the uk for the birthday. The meal (banquet)was excellent so many fabulous courses finishing with a birthday cake. A big Thankyou to the chefs  , waiters etc. All the staff are so friendly and helpful the hotel runs like clockwork. It is so well managed by  Antonio , Isobel and Pierangelo . The reception staff  are  always so kind and helpful .especially Martha and  Perla . 
The hotel is sheer luxury .the gardens  are  beautiful . We enjoyed the swimming  pool as the weather was perfect . We also enjoyed superb breakfasts outside in the garden each morning. 
We look forward to our next visit .

Title: A real gem in Puglia
Text: Amazing hotel in an old authentic masseria where you walk through an orange grove or have your aperitivo sitting by a quiet stone paved pool. It's our third time in Tenuta Moreno and this time we had another nice surprice: more attention to details, new furniture and a vegetable garden. Our dinner was amazing and our expert and professional waiter, Gennaro presented and recommended what to order: we had il boccaccio, a fish soup cooked in boiling water!Delicious and hard to forget as the whole experience.

Title: Very quiet in February...
Text: Situated close to the SS7 and not to far to Brindisi, we chose this hotel due to its proximity to Brindisi airport and the towns of Alberbello, Ostuni and Matera. Reception staff were attentive and our room comfortable, but a bit dated. Expansive  and well kept public areas with very nice gardens. WiFi in bedroom with a few English TV news channels. This hotel is rather isolated and a car is essential, but we were were of aware of its location so quite happy overall. The main disappointment was breakfast: very limited selection due to the small number of guests staying at the hotel. This is understandable in order to reduce costs in the winter months.

Title: Beautiful, luxury hotel in green surroundings !
Text:
Luxury, soundproof room (suite) with a special blue shower. Friendly staff. Ideal place from where you can discover Puglia; from Brindisi to Bari, from Alberobello to Lecce. You do need a car but we knew that in advance. Even Mesagne is charming town. Breakfast was rather basic but it was probably because it was already november, so low season and not that many guests.
For sure a hotel we would like to visit again in summer.

Title: Paradise
Text: This was our second stay at Tenuta Moreno. Throughout our four night stay all the staff were attentive, friendly and courteous. The hotel is peaceful with large indoor and outdoor areas in which to relax and enjoy tranquillity. Floral arrangements adorn all public areas and tables. The food is excellent and the choice very good, at breakfast, lunch and dinner, The wine selection is extensive. The vegetable garden is productive. The bedroom and all public areas are spacious and spotless. A big thank you to the management team of this very well appointed, luxurious hotel and we look forward to our next visit.

Title: Nice
Text:
Nice hotel located in the middle of olive trees.
Very quite surroundings
Facilities are good, but not perfect. The rooms are very large
the hotel is in a point of time where they will have to make choice: wether they repair small broke, things or not. For example: a swimmongbool borderstone is broken but not paired, airco is not working properly, some light fittings are installed on the terrace but without light in in...

This hotel has much potential, it would be a shame to let this go

Moreover the food is from good quality but needs some variation. There was no alternatives for the pure italian food.

The spa was great, very clean and up to date.

Title: Nice hotel with amazing pool
Text:
We stayed with 6 people 6 nights in this hotel in Mesagne, Puglia (south italy).
This rather big hotel (when you drive around the region, you see billboards reffering to this hotel everywhere) has everything to make your holiday a nice relaxing one with everything you need.
There is lots of choice for breakfast (large buffet)(eggs as well). Just make sure you eat before 9 am as thereafter you risk not having anything anymore (e.g no more croissants, no more fruit...) as they stop replacing the empty plates...
If you decide to eat in the hotel in the evening, make sure you are in time as well as otherwise you risk the same thing as with the breakfast (we went at 8 pm and were left with an empty buffet...). There is a nice town close by though (10 min by car) with plenty of restaurants.
The hotel staff is very friendly and also helps you without a problem with tips for local good restraurants. I would definitely only take hotel + breakfast (not including dinner)(this is also what we did).
The rooms are spacious with airco, hairdryer, decent bathroom, large beds (hard matras though).
Some rooms have a problem with the airco, but the staff easily helps out.
The swimming pool is really really nice (picture right out of a catalogue). 
Overall, very nice hotel. The organisation could be a bit better though, but I think they have sometimes too much on their mind as they had virtually every evening a wedding party taking place while we were there too.
On that note, it is sometimes a bit bizar if you walk in your swimshort while the wedding party guests are there next to you fully dressed up... It would be better if these locations were better split up.
Wifi was only available at the reception. It did not reach far enough to get access in the rooms or at the pools.

Title: Amazing place
Text:
I've spent three nights here. It was amazing. This is a superb and really quite location. Excellent food and service.  I've tried so many Italian dishes. Great choice of vine.
I'll be back one day for sure. :)

Title: Fantastic
Text: Superb location, even if you need a car to be able to move. Fantastic mixture of old stones and modern equipments. Superb personnel (grazie Emanuella and the other receptionists, grazie Luigi, Lorenzo and their colleagues at the bar and the swimming pool), they all made our stay unforgettable. Super nice breakfast with fresh orange juice and juice extractor for carrots and apples. AND GREAT ITALIAN COFFEE! BIG swimming pool where you can lie under the palm trees for some shade. PARADISE on earth!!!

Title: Excellent
Text:
We spent two nights in this wonderful hotel. The accommodation is fantastic . It is a very tranquil residence the grounds are beautifully kept with wonderful flower arrangements throughout the hotel  . All the staff are very friendly and helpful including the directors, reception staff , waiters , cleaners etc. the room we had was very spacious with contemporary fixtures amazing shower and a pleasant sitting area outside the room. 
The meals were of a very high quality and beautifully presented .

Title: Hidden gem!
Text: Our son stayed here 6 months working for Boeing.  We visited while he was here.  Facilities and staff were top notch!  Could not ask for any better accommodations or friendlier staff.  Weddings seemed a daily occurrence-Loved to see the brides & the fireworks!  Would go back in minute.

Title: Excellent!
Text: I stayed here on business and it was brilliant. In total, I have stayed in this hotel for over 6 weeks and every stay was excellent and had great staff, service, food, and rooms. I would highly recommend it if you're visiting the area...and try the Selvarossa wine too.

Title: Quiet and out of the way
Text: Beautiful hotel. Appreciate it was out of season but the menu in the restaurant was very limited. Poolside bar was idyllic and the sauna and spa a welcome treat. Would have loved to  have spent more time there.   Staff very helpful considering how many off us checked in at the same time !

Title: tenuta moreno
Text: Super! Beautiful swimming pool! Nice bar! A bit far from everything! Good service! Good food and good meals (a bit too much in half-pension!). Nice sites to visit around (Brindisi, Lecce, Galipoli, Monopoli, Alberobello, Ostuni, Carovigno...)

Title: Lovely location outside of  town
Text:
This is a huge complex outside of the little town.  Because of the size, they are able to accommodate large tours.  Four were there while we were.  However, despite the size and large groups, we still felt special and never had to wait for service or food.   They seem to have plenty of waitstaff and our group  aways had our own space.  The breakfast buffet is large and you can also order eggs however you want them.  Staff speak English and are always pleasant and helpful.  There are two pools but we were too early in the season to enjoy them.  One member of our group rented a bicycle for 5 euros to ride around the countryside on paths recommended by the staff.  My room was very large but my "balcony" was a narrow concrete corridor to a screened barrier to a small garden with no chairs and a very limited view.  The only disappointing part of my stay.

Also unlike other hotels we stayed at, this place actually had internet that worked in my room.

Title: Excellent place
Text:
I think it's one of the best place in Puglia.
The location is fantastic, the restaurant is at the top. A very well organized place in the country of Mesagne, only 2 minutes drive from the highway, 15 from the Airport. I spend my spare time with my family every time we can, in summer, and to celebrate birthdays, Christamas, Easter, etc. 
The facility has been recently renovated. It's wonderful.
The SPA is excellent, very clean and relaxing. The two ladies who manage the center are very professional and kind.
The pool is huge!!!
If you are planning to visit Puglia, don't surf in the internet to find another place, go there right now. I strongly reccommend Tenuta Moreno.

Title: Wonderful Resort
Text: I traveled into here on advice from a co-worker.  Wonderful hotel and staff.  The room was very large and inviting.  Having never been to Europe, I was shocked.  The morning breakfast was nice and simple and the dinner menu was full.  The food and service was top-notch!!  Only drawback is that the resort is off the beaten track.  If you are looking for a place to stay and move about, this is it.

Title: A lovely country retreat
Text:
I have stayed in the hotel several times, the latest being a week from the 21st August 2012. A lot of thought, care and attention has gone into creating this hotel, for me the rating is definitely worthy of 4* and more. This extends from the outside to the inside, from the clean lines of the bedrooms and modern bathrooms with top quality toiletries, to the bars and restaurants.

Inside is cool, calm and airy, the stylish main building a good mix of traditional and modern, beautiful tiles and lighting. Outside: spacious terraces and balconies, beautiful grounds with various fruit trees and palms; vegetables and herbs, in a well laid out garden, which are used in the kitchen; an elegant swimming pool with a lifeguard. The various function rooms around the complex do not seem to cause disturbance to the other guests.

As in any international hotel you will hear many languages spoken, but in my experience the tour groups are not overwhelming, though it might be helpful to other guests if the group-advertised trips and events indicated whether they are open to all or for that group only. The hotel also benefits from a multi-lingual library. Nonetheless I met and spoke to several Italian guests who actually lived fairly close to the hotel and were enjoying being home from home. English is spoken; particularly well in reception, but any staff member with lesser skill in dealing with complex matters would always quickly find somebody who could help.

As in any eco-minded hotel, sheets and towels are changed when the guest indicates. The eco-credentials extend to not poisoning the immediate environment. I was pleased to see and hear a range of birds flying in the gardens and see several species of butterfly. As a consequence one is likely to encounter the occasional fly in the open-air bars and restaurants, but fortunately they were not large or a big nuisance, they were most noticeable at the end of breakfast if you were the last people left in the dining area. Since the hotel is situated in a vast area of fruit and nut orchards, co-existing with all god’s creatures is not a big risk and I’m sure the environmentally sensitive hotel is a big draw for most guests.

I don’t need a lot of pomp and fuss; and excess facilities and services when I just want to relax.

Title: Nice place to relax
Text:
This is the first time we stayed in this hotel and we would certainly come back. I even recommend it to friends and family. Very friendly and helpfull staff.(the manager was there for any questions, showing around, touristic information,...she made you feel very welcome)
Food was excellent and we had plenty of choice. The dining area outside was enchanting as well the one inside, we ate in the winecellar between the primitivo's and the barrollo's. They serve delicious local wines at a very democratic price. The rooms were spacious, but a little outdated. 
The wellness facilities are clean and very enjoyable as well as the outside pool.
If you like to visit, you will need a rental car.

Title: Enchanting location
Text: This is the third time I'm visiting la Tenuta Moreno in the charming Salento region.I must say that the accomodation provided by this hotel has always been of the highest level. I travel frequently and I must say this is one of the most relaxing spots I've ever encountered. What I find amazing about this place is the friendly and warm welcome I receive whenever I stay at the Tenuta Moreno. It's as if I'm practically home. The ambience at the Tenuta is just wonderful. You're surrounded by olive trees and enchanting countryside; this is complemented with superb facilities at the Tenuta Moreno...a huge pool, a very good spa resort, and most important of all, very spacious rooms with huge bathrooms. If you're leading a stressful life, this is the place where you have to head to, in order to unwined. The last but not the least, the culinary aspect. The food has always been a fantastic experience with local products derived from the lands surrounding the said hotel.

Title: Great location for Weddings
Text: Very nice hotel with a large pool. great breakfast with a variety of fresh products. Amazing wedding facilities and friendly staff. the rooms a very large and fully equipped with A/C, minibar, safe, shutle service to the nearest town mesagne.

Title: What a nice surprise!
Text:
The resort is located in a secluded area in the middle of Puglia's countryside. It is so isolated that sometimes there is no signal on your mobile phone in some of the rooms. This makes it is a perfect retreat from chaotic life and definitely a win.

That said, it is self-evident that you must have a car to move around if you do not wish to bust your wallet with taxis. If you like to enjoy the place, the hotel has all the comforts you need, including a beautiful swimming pool.  The morning breakfast buffet is outstanding and the food at the restaurant is simply superb. I really had a couple of memorable meals.

The rooms however are not much inspiring.  There is absolutely nothing wrong with them, but they look rather anonymous, old-styled and somewhat "cheap" in such a nice environment. The price is right.

Title: Pleasant resort in the middle of the countryside
Text: We stayed here with a group including extended family for four nights. It was our base to explore other areas of southern Italy. We enjoyed the pool and spa facilities.  Our room was large and clean but had a musky (mildew?) odor. The other rooms in our group were fine. We didn't switch rooms because it was bearable and we wanted to be near our family. The food and service were very good; we had all of our meals here.  We especially enjoyed the breakfast. For such a remote region, the hotel had a surprising amount of guests and activities which made it feel lively.  The restaurant and bar staff were especially kind and accommodating.

Title: A Wonderful Stay in Apulia
Text:
My wife and I stayed at the Tenuta Moreno for 4 days in June 2011 along with a small group on an escorted tour. The grounds of the hotel were beautiful and the pool outstanding. The food was good, not great. The location could not have been better for our tour plans. 

The drawback was our mixed emotions about the rooms. Large but aged and very dark. It felt like we were in a cave. The bathrooms we bright and large. 

The front desk was a mixed bag. Generally, very grumpy but serviceable.

Title: Oasis in the Middle of Nowhere
Text: This is a beautiful property and is great for the person who sees it as a destination rather than a place from which to explore Puglia.  It is out in the country and therefore, the only way to get around to see the area is by car or tour bus.  Fortunately, we were with a tour and so we were taken to Lecce, Alberobello, Ostuni, etc.  However, we were stuck there for dinner all four nights and, while the food was OK, I would have preferred to have stayed in a town where we could have had dinner at a local trattoria and walked around the area.  (a taxi to Brindisi cost 40 euro each way). The pool and grounds are beautiful (see photos) and our room was first class.  The staff in all areas of the hotel were friendly and helpful.  Tenuta Moreno is a great spot for a family travelling with kids because of the wonderful pool and other activities.  If you stay here with the goal of exploring the trullis of Alberobello, the baroque architecture of Lecce or visiting one of many farms in Puglia, you must have a car.

Title: Excellent hotel, countryside location
Text:
The hotel is very big and so are the rooms, The pool is one of the biggest I've seen
The gardens and settings are fantastic
Staff are polite and speak little English
I would recommend going into Mesagne to eat as you will get better food and better value
Overall an excellent place to stay

Title: beautiful hotel
Text:
ive stayed there a few times now and this is a really beautiful property.  the grounds are lovely, the pool is SPECTACULAR, the restaurant is nice and accomodating.

if you want a lovely getaway vacation in Puglia, it is the place to go.

the only things that would improve this hotel would be a gym and free internet.

Title: Excellent Stay
Text:
We stayed for 5 nights at this hotel and had a great time. The service was outstanding,friendly and welcoming as well as very helpful. They enabled us to spend a day in Lecce using trains and the hotels shuttle bus which was great fun and saved a hairy drive. We were especially grateful for the local knowledge in buying the train ticket which was not as straight forward as we'd expected.
The pool and restaurant were of a very high standard and although the decor and design of the room was fairly standard the balcony was great and the room was well kept and equipped.

Title: A Hidden Jewell
Text:
I have had the oportunity to have stayed here four times this year from deepest January until steaming May and I think that the company I work for has truly descovered a hidden jewell. 
OK so first impressions (in the dark) in January were a little discoloured as there was a distinct lack of atmosphere, and the only guests were my colleagues! But hey, this is the same wherever you go in the region, however I found the staff more than helpful and the quality of service from the management to the cleaners was first class, and I quickly realised that this would develope in subsequent visits.
The air conditioned rooms are very spacious, clean and tidy with balconies.
Take time out to explore the grounds - they are massive with something for everyone including manicured lawns, terraces, a range of water features, large and small pools, tennis and a small soccer pitch - and it will become apparent why this hotel is used extensively for well to do weddings and parties, but the service does not alter whoever you are and whatever the question. 
There is varied cuisine to be had both in the resturaunt and around the various pool bars-just ask if you fancy something else.
My subsequent visits have seen the hotel really blossom along with the countryside, and in reply to those who complain that "nothing is in English"...why don't you take time out to learn a little Italian? Afterall not everyone speaks Italian in my neck of the woods! You will soon find that a bit of effort goes a long way. I have found the staff to have a real professional approach with humour in a range of languages.
 The wine selection is excellent (please try the Selvarossa even at 15 euros a pop) and the reaturaunt staff are more than competant to deal with most questions.
If you are fortunate to stay while they are hosting a wedding then boy, will you find out how to really push the boat out from the preparation to the finish.
You do need a car though, and why not as it really does push you out there to explore the Puglie region (try to get to Otranto and Lecce)

Excellent, Excellent, Excellent!!

Title: superb masseria with a friendly smile
Text: 2nd time we stayed at the Tenuta Moreno (2004, and now). The food is delicious and authentic, the staff are very child friendly, and frankly speaking the only hotel in the world (having been to many...) where the hotel manager is visibly present every (!) day, greeting guests personally every day. The quiet pool is discrete, sheltered and offer privacy, the main pool is a children's best dream, with plenty of deck chairs, shadowy places that still offer a good overview of the pool. The rooms are very spacious. We took the family room for 4. All rooms have a private terrace as well. There is also a playing area for children, and the whole place is well-kept and maintained. The rastaurant has a large garden with orange trees, so kids can play while parents enjoy their meal.  A definite recommendation, I have already sent many friends there !

Title: Comfortable for one night
Text:
My husband and I were bicycling around Puglia and chose the Grand Hotel Tenuta Moreno because of its location -- it was the right distance between our prior night in Savelletri and our next stop in Lecce.  It is in the middle of nowhere so to speak, although I can see why it is used for conventions and weddings -- it's right off the highway and has a lot of facilities.  It is several miles outside Mesagne, which by the way has a very lovely central square and beautiful cathedral.  

We were initially surprised when we arrived -- a sprawling property and on a Sunday afternoon there were multiple parties going on at once.  However, we were greeted nicely (which is saying something, since we arrive on bicycle!), a bellboy went out of his way to help us put the bikes in a safe storage area, and the front desk staff were very pleasant.  She even said that once we had cleaned up, she would take us to the bar for a complimentary drink.

The hotel is furnished attractively in the lobbies and hallways; our room (deluxe?) was very large (clearly appropriate for a family) and had a little private terrace, and very clean (tile floor, nice bathroom) but it's pretty sterile -- desk, beds, chair -- nothing upholstered and the bedspreads, curtains etc were not very attractive.  

Still, when we did clean up and returned to the front desk, a woman took us on a tour of the property, explained why there were so many functions, and promised it would be quieter in the evening.  She took us to the bar at the pool and we enjoyed a very lovely area and great drink.  Later that evening, we ate in the hotel restaurant and found it more than satisfactory.  It's an attractive room, although the lighting is too bright, and we had very good service and a very tasty meal.  Maybe not big on "atmosphere", but it was very nice.  Breakfast the next morning was an enormous buffet and we found that platters were filled or replaced very promptly.  (Coffee service was odd though -- we had to chase down a waitress to order what we wanted and she never came back.)

All in all, it was a comfortable night and convenient for us.  However, given all the other interesting, small, personal hotels we used during the rest of the trip, I would not choose the Grant Hotel except if the location was convenient.  To my surprise, it seemed that some guests were staying for multiple nights or a whole week -- there are MUCH more atmostpheric places to stay in the lovely towns of Ostuni, Martina Franca, Alberobello or Lecce.  It's not a bad place, just not very memorable and more for tour groups.

Title: que bella
Text:
Not sure what the other reviews that claim unfriendly staff are about.  I spent 10 days here and had no problems.  The staff is as friendly as I like staff to be. They're not fawning and obsequious, but will serve you well.  They cater to your needs, but probably not to whims.  If it can be done, they'll do it for you.  The grounds are simply spectacular and the location is in the boonies a bit.  We had a car, so we found it peaceful and quiet. The food was very good and the wait staff well trained.  The room we had was comfortable and very clean, although the bed was a bit hard for my taste. 

My only down side was that I got there before the pool was open.  They didn't fill it until two days before I left.  I did get to use it, though, and it is a beautiful pool with shaded areas and sunny spots.  The only thing I could have asked for was more time. I love this hotel and would definitely go again.

Title: just an illusion
Text:
nothing good for us...orrible rooms, not good food, staff arrogance....never again here.
we book for 3 days we start the 2th

Title: fantastic place to Stay
Text:
The company I work for has had a number of people stay at this hotel, over a number of weeks.  Personally, I stayed here for 15 days, and some guys over 1 month.

The staff are fantastic, and have helped all of us learn and develop our Italian.  Every single day, both morning and night, we have had greetings and salutations.  It has been a pleasure to be served by these guys - especially Luigi and Adolfo!  One of the team has had the same room over a number of weeks, and any laundry left has been put back in his room while he returned to England.  Thats the actions of people who want to help you have a comfortable stay!

The grounds are fantastic and even have oranges on the tree's as I write.  There are no noises at all from traffic or aircraft, so its a really relaxing place.

Location is good for Brindisi airport, and taranto - but a car is advisable, because the hotel is in the middle of nowhere!

The food is varied, with traditional Italian food served, and a menu which is never the same for two days.

If you want an authentic Italian stay - come to this place - its fantsatic.  If you want to be served on, hand and foot, and people who speak perfect English, stay at home!

This is good, honest, Italian culture - and i love it!

Title: Unfriendly staff and too expensive for what you get
Text: This hotel has beautiful grounds.  That is the only positive.  From the Brindisi airport, the hotel was a 60 Euro, 20 minute cab ride.  Ouch.  Nothing is close so a car is essential.  The staff was mediocre at best.  Any question to them elicited a frown and why-are-you-bothering-me look.   It took more than a day for staff to clean up after a large wedding party.  The rooms are fairly large and some have balconies.  However, for the same money, much more pleasant accomodations exist.

Title: Fabulous complex, mediocre staff
Text:
We have just spent a week here. The buildings and grounds are absolutely gorgeous and well-tended and the pool is simply the best we have ever been to. Our room was spacious, well-appointed and had a huge balcony. However, the staff left a lot to be desired with the exception of Luigi the barman who was very friendly and efficient.  On arrival we were met by surly staff at reception who spoke little or no English. There were newspapers and folders in German and Dutch but nothing in English. The reception staff were more interested in chatting to each other than trying to assist. The piped music at reception was also off-putting. There was absolutely no information in the room other than a card about using the telephone and it was like pulling teeth to find out about the restaurant, swimming pool opening times, laundry service etc etc. There were weddings almost every day and sometimes we could not get access to all of the public areas although the firework displays were a bonus. I saw 2 cats sitting on the top table one day - ugh!!!!

At breakfast we often had to go in search of coffee/tea as the waiters were standing around chatting instead of acknowledging people.  No-one said good morning and no matter what time we came down there was always something missing eg no cold meat or no cheese or on one occasion no plates or spoons!!! There was frequently no cloth to put over the bread resulting in everyone  handling the bread as they cut slices!!!! The chef did cook breakfasts to order and in fairness they were very good.

We used the restaurant in the evening several times but were not impressed. We ate outside in a very attractive area and candles on the tables and soft lighting added to the effect. The food was bland, often cold and not the standard we had expected of a hotel of this quality and we were very disappointed. Again although the restaurant was not particularly busy we had to wait for menus and drinks for up to 15 minutes on occasion. We also objected strongly to the 6 feral cats/kittens which were running around the tables, jumping on to chairs and clawing at our legs. In our opinion the management should have done something about this. This to us was unacceptable and we complained about it but nothing was done. On talking to fellow guests we discovered that others shared our views. We went into Mesagne (the nearest town) twice and had superb food at half the price.

The pool area was wonderful but again the pool bar seemed to open at a different time every day and on 2 occasions we could not get towels until 11am!!!! Nevertheless we greatly enjoyed this area.

When we checked out we paid our considerable bill and did not receive one word of thanks, nor were we asked if we had enjoyed our stay, wished a safe onward journey or any of the usual pleasantries. The receptionist had enough English to do this.  She was conducting a conversation with a colleague whilst processing our bill and did not make eye contact once. 

It is a great shame as the Tenuta Moreno has superb facilities and a fabulous setting. It was coming to the end of the season and it showed!!!!!

Title: Brilliant holiday!
Text:
Friends of ours got married near by and the bride suggested we stay here for a couple of nights after the wedding - we decided to stay for 4 days/nights after the wedding and we did not regret it!

Although it was abit out of the way (you really should get a car or have some form of transport if you want to get out and about), it was absolutely fabulous for us, as we wanted to relax by the pool, and eat good food. 

We had the opportunity to have dinner there on the last night and it was brilliant - very fresh seafood, very reasonably priced and all in all, a good deal. Note, you don't have to have the 'entire course' of antipasti, first course of pasta and 2nd course of a meat dish. You can do it ala-carte style. 

It's about 20 minutes from Brindisi airport so it's a good getaway if you fly RyanAir and pop round to this hotel for a few days r&r.

Those of you who are planning a wedding in Italy - I wouldn't know anything about the legal aspects, but if you want a beautiful reception with lots and lots and lots of lovely food and a great time, you should contact these people. It was very elegant, very beautiful and they appeared to cater a very personal service. They can hold weddings at either this hotel, or their sister restaurant Casa Resta!

Title: Very friendly hotel with good food and a nice ambience
Text: The staff is always very professional, friendly and competent. The entire hotel is very clean. The rooms are very nicely designed and decorated in a southern colonial style. Each room has a beautiful balcony overlooking a green courtyard. Each balcony has a closed mosquito net. The beds and pillows are comfortable and the sleep quality is very good. Breakfast is sufficient: There are various cakes, breads, confectionery and div. Cold cuts. Hot dishes such as omelettes are freshly prepared. Dinner is very good. On the menu there are four starters and four main courses to choose from every evening. The service is always very competent and friendly. The wine list leaves nothing to be desired. After dinner you can spend a few hours in the bar with a cocktail. The Long Island Ice Tea is highly recommended and the cappucino is an absolute highlight. The hotel is a bit off the beaten track near Mesagne. A rental car is an absolute must. The Autostradas are easy to reach the cities of Bari, Brindisi, Matera and Gallipoli. The hotel has a wellness area with very friendly and competent staff. We enjoyed our stay very much and would definitely go there again.

Title: Super recommended location
Text: In this beautiful property I celebrated my wedding, I went back for my sister's wedding and once again I was pleasantly surprised, all very nice, very kind and helpful staff. She celebrated in the cool really beautiful and suggestive as a location; once again I was super happy and like me all the relatives and friends present.

Beautiful swimming pool!

Title: A beautiful experience
Text: I only gave 5 points because more can't be given. Wonderful and elegant structure. Perfect staff always available. I asked if it was possible to charge my electric car and was immediately satisfied. Large and luxurious room, perfect breakfast, large pool and well organized as indeed the whole structure. Restaurant characterized by really good dishes and presented impeccably. The lobby of the property is elegant with typical ceramic pieces. Structure highly recommended. I will definitely return.

Title: Fantastic.
Text:
We booked our summer holidays with my family in wonderful Puglia.  Unfortunately we had a disappointment from a previous structure which was really disappointing.  We left the facility and coincidentally we 
found availability at Tenuta Moreno. Just arrived we are greeted by two beautiful dogs Filippo and Morena but above all the beauty of the location, surrounded by the greenery of olive trees and figs of Puglia, with fountains and walls typical of Lecce stone ..... in short, a paradise. The kindness and professionalism of all the staff, the reception staff, the waiters in the breakfast room, restaurant and bar, the ladies cleaning the rooms .... in short, there is perfection .

Title: Highly recommended
Text:
Nice and clean structure, friendly and welcoming staff, comfortable and well furnished rooms, very large pool. Excellent breakfast, bar and restaurant allocated in beautiful locations. 
It is really worth spending your holidays in this beautiful property.

Title: EXCELLENT in every respect
Text: Hotel Tenuta Moreno never disappoints itself, giving those who choose the structure the pleasure of leaving one year behind and starting another in a big way - you have to live it to understand the greatness of what it leaves inside you. Excellent staff above all expectations and professionalism

Title: Wedding Lunch
Text: The Moreno estate for a wedding lunch, reception or any type of party can be said to be the top. Well-kept environments, beautiful garden with water features, fantastic swimming pools, ample and convenient parking, excellent food, carefully prepared dishes and impeccable service. I think it's hard to find better.

Title: Absolutely not up to what you pay
Text: We decided to spend a weekend in this structure, very beautiful and pleasant to look at. However, all that glitters is not always gold. Beautiful and spacious room, so modern in style that there weren't even any bedside tables, so much so that to place something on it we had to move a chair closer to the bed. But that's the least of it. From a particularly elegant hotel we would have expected a breakfast consistent with the luxury of the Masseria. Another disappointment: almost nothing salty, in fact absolutely nothing if we exclude the "eggs" corner where they prepared omelettes which were a real omelette, not at all exciting. Not to mention the dinner, included in the expensive package purchased: frozen seafood salad; meat ordered rare and arrived very cooked; poor quality fried calamari. The waiter who served us had told us that the chef would match the side dishes. Well, one of the surroundings did not arrive. In short, for what we paid it wasn't worth it

Title: A pleasant certainty!
Text:
Tenuta Moreno is for me, as for my family, a place that feels like home and above all a certainty for our anniversaries.
Exceptional staff, 0 km raw materials, impeccable service.
Even for my 30th birthday I chose Tenuta Moreno and as always it respected the rules
Our expectations.
This time we had the
Nice to have Settimio leading the dining room team, a very pleasant person as well as the rest of the staff.
For me, a smile is essential for an ideal festive atmosphere and it is what they never lack.
In addition to the impeccable quality of each dish, I would like to pay particular praise to the cake and desserts which I LOVE! Nun tits and naked cake ♥️ Top Top!
The location is also not negligible, always perfectly clean and well-kept :)
Thank you, as always, Tenuta Moreno!

Title: Kindness and courtesy
Text: We went to a wedding, beautiful location and average service. We ate well. Friendly and helpful staff. We had a really pleasant day. Very good starters and first courses

Title: Disappointment
Text:
Really unpleasant, old and vulgar staff. We had a really bad time, they cleaned the room poorly and they didn't change the sheets. We're sorry because it looked like a really elegant estate but it's not like that at all, hair and hair everywhere, full of dust and the minibar broken.
This isn't Ibiza, it's Tenuta Moreno.

Title: Excellent location but to be revisited
Text:
we returned after 11 years to this resort which surprised us with its careful management. The estate is always very beautiful but the organization including the
Restaurant is no longer as before
The reception was kind in replacing our room with a more comfortable one

Bicycle available out of use, swimming pool beautiful but with little maintenance, hydromassage not working and shower closed

Let's say that it would be enough to pay more attention to the details and give a little more personality to the entire organization to reevaluate everything

Excellent location for visiting places of cultural and naturalistic interest

Title: Top
Text: Top is the right adjective to describe this place...wonderful location, well-kept outdoor space, large and clean rooms, abundant breakfast (excellent hot pasticciotti), good value for money even in high season

Title: Ottimo soggiorno
Text: Ho soggiornato presso questa struttura ed ho trovato la camera molto pulita, accogliente e curata nel minimo dettaglio. Ringraziamo lo staff di Tenuta Moreno in particolare coloro che si occupano delle camere per il servizio.

Title: Heruntergekommene Anlage - hier stört der Gast
Text:
Schon beim Einchecken waren die Mitarbeiter eher gelangweilt und schienen sich gestört zu fühlen.
Dieses Verhalten zog sich wie ein roter Faden durch unseren Aufenthalt.
Die Anlage selbst war vielleicht einmal sehr schön - aber in den letzten 15 Jahren ist hier nichts mehr investiert worden,  Offensichtlich haben die hier durchgeschleusten Reisegruppen deutliche Spuren hinterlassen.
Als 4 Sterne-Haus deutlich überbewertet - hat eher den Charme einer Jugendherberge
Wir haben unseren Aufenthalt vorzeitig beendet.

Title: Matrimonio a Moreno: ulivo, rose e margherite.
Text: Abbiamo scelto Moreno per il nostro matrimonio, rito civile e festa. Tutto un incanto, perfezione assoluta. Location impeccabile, professionisti capaci di rendere ogni particolare eccellenza, ... con semplicità.

Title: Un oasi di piacere
Text: un posto dove non solo la cucina è ricercata e di ottimo livello ma dove la natura e la ricerca ecosostenibile viene praticata da anni compreso l'approvvigionamento di alcune materie prime direttamente dai giardini ed orti alla tavola

Title: tenuta moreno mesagne una eccellenza
Text:
eccellente...location che non può che soddisfare qualunque necessità. cucina di ottimo livello e senza compromessi..personale straordinario.
la tenuta moreno è insomma una vera mscchina da guera del saper accogliere intrattenere a tavola e cullare il suo pubnlico.bravi veramente.

Title: Un matrimonio incantevole.
Text: Auguro a tutti i futuri sposi di sentirsi grati come noi a questa fantastica struttura! Si sono presi cura e attenzione di noi sin dal primo giorno in cui siamo andati a visitarla. Un grazie speciale va al Signor Pierangelo Argentieri, che ci ha guidato e consigliato offrendoci tutta la sua esperienza nel campo, un professionista dai gusti eleganti e raffinati, che ha colto in pieno cosa volevamo già dal primo colloquio e si è messo a nostra disposizione come pochi direttori fanno; un grazie di cuore va anche a tutti i collaboratori della tenuta, ci sentiamo di ringraziarli davvero tutti, in particolar modo Daniela che ci ha seguito egregiamente, mettendoci a nostro agio. La tenuta nel nostro giorno si è presentata curatissima, nulla era lasciato al caso, impeccabile il servizio in tutte le location; Hanno avuto 1000 occhi per i nostri ospiti riscuotendo i complimenti da ogni singolo invitato. Le portate erano di primissima qualità, il servizio eccellente. Che dire...li risceglieremmo altre milioni di volte, è stato un successone. Grazie da Andrea e Valentina

Title: Sicurezza zero
Text: Ideale per tornare a casa in sedia a rotelle. La sicurezza è meno di un optional. Servizio abbastanza serio ma per il resto è semplicemente uno scandalo. E il peggio che si fanno anche la ragione. Mai più.

Title: Bella location moderna
Text: Ottima location nella campagna pugliese, struttura moderna e spaziosa con area Spa il cui costo di accesso 40 eu, ampie le camere e gli spazi comuni, parcheggio interno spazioso, ottima qualità al ristorante, le camere affacciano su un giardino interno, silenziose

Title: Costi eccessivamente esagerati……..!!!!
Text:
La tenuta è molto bella spaziosa con molto verde e una meravigliosa piscina sempre pulita
La nostra camera comoda, il bagno ancora con vasca era  cieco, il letto matrimoniale abbastanza comodo si apriva nel mezzo, bastava un topper per risolvere il problema, da rivedere la pulizia  in camera sempre con molta polvere sui mobili…….
Il personale in sala e al bar era meraviglioso sempre disponibile e sorridente tranne la signora alla reception……….
Il cibo buono , ma estremamente costoso…….tipo frutta mista €10 , dolci al mini buffet €10 anche se prendivi solo una fetta di torta o due pasticcini…..
Al bar idem…… un panino dai €10  ai 13 €….. assurdo senza parlare delle bevande e alcolici…
Da controllare il conto finale…….
Personalmente non ci tornerei , nella zona ci sono molte altre masserie e tenute 
Costo alto!!!

Title: Matrimonio da sogno
Text: Ci siamo sposati il 10.08.22 è stato semplicemente un sogno. Tenuta Moreno è stata fin da subito la nostra prima scelta e non ci sbagliavamo. Cibo ottimo, servizio impeccabile. Daniela la nostra wedding planen è stata molto gentile e disponibile ha realizzato ogni nostro desiderio. Il personale professionale e disponibile. Ci hanno fatto vivere davvero una giornata indimenticabile.

Title: Notte da incubo
Text: Abbiamo pernottato un sola notte e direi che ci é pure bastata. La stanza era imbarazzante. Imbarazzante nella manutenzione non da un 4 stelle ma forse per un 2 stelle. Sanitari palesemente usurati, macchie ovunque, segni di muffa.... Le foto parlano da sole. Forse la struttura era un 4 stelle 20 anni fa ma ora avrebbe bisogno di un investimento di ammodernamento. Pagare 150 euro per questi livelli é imbarazzante. Aria condizionata gestibile solo da reception e quando ho chiesto che venisse regolata perché vi era una temperatura troppo bassa e fredda mi ha risposto: "possiamo spegnerla", l'unica soluzione era spegnerla ...... No word. Bagno cieco con ventola del bagno non funzionante. Telefono con segni di polvere sotto la cornetta di molte settimane. Ci siamo accorti di tutto questo solo alla sera perché ospiti di un matrimonio e dover fare entrare qualcuno in camera le 23:00 non ci sembrava il caso. Colazione nulla di  eclatante. Leggermente sopra la sufficienza. Pochi gli alimenti freschi, abbiamo dovuto chiedere più volte per l'acqua, perennemente terminata, le arance per la spremuta fresca e salumi. Poi una attesa di 15 minuti per il caffè, una macchinetta automatica presente. Alla mia risposta se fosse l'unica presente e che farmi 15 minuti di attesa per un caffè mi é stato risposto che potevo dirigermi al bar della piscina, dovendo attraversare Er intero la struttura e caricarlo sulla stanza? Se quella povera macchinetta automatica si fosse rotta? Morale? Esperienza unica nel suo genere, peccato che sia solo che negativa.

Title: Ideal, um Apulien kennenzulernen
Text: Wir haben sechs Nächte in dem Hotel verbracht, um mit einem Mietwagen Apulien zu erkunden. Allerdings ist das Anwesen so gross und schön, dass wir dann doch mehr Zeit als gedacht im Hotel verbracht haben und auch häufiger als gedacht dort zu Abend gegessen haben. Ein besonderer Dank gilt Maurizio von der Bar, der uns jeden Abend mit guter Laune, guten Drinks und vielen Informationen versorgte. Ein besonderes Highlight ist die Terrasse vom Zimmer, die in einen begrünten Innenhof führt, ein Innenhof mit nur einem versteckten Zugang, der praktisch nie von Menschen besucht wird. Da die Terrasse mit einem Fliegengitter abgesperrt ist, ergibt sich Privatsphäre pur im Freien und auch noch frei von Insekten. Auch der weitläufige Poolbereich und die Bar dort sind zu loben. Abgesehen von Kommunionen, Geburtstagen und Hochzeiten finden auf dem Hotelgelände offensichtlich auch sehr viele Weinproben und Lehrgänge statt, es war somit nicht nur für uns der ideale Ort, um die besten Rotweine der Welt zu erkunden. Da das Gelände sehr weitläufig ist, können sich Hotelgäste und Feiernde sehr gut aus dem Weg gehen, das gilt übrigens auch für die wirklich sehr vielen Parkplätze. Leider sind viele der wohl früher mal wunderschönen und grösstenteils wohl uralten Ölbäume auf dem Gelände nicht von der örtlichen Seuche mit dem Xylella Fastidiosa Bakterium verschont geblieben. Das Frühstücksbuffet ist als optimierbar zu bezeichnen, nur eine Kaffeemaschine in einem italienischen Hotel ist dann doch überraschend, Kochplatten und Personal für eine frisch zubereitete Eierspeise sind komplett vorhanden, die Möglichkeit wird aber aus nicht ersichtlichen Gründen nicht zur Verfügung gestellt. An der Rezeption kann man übrigens auf Nachfrage die eine grosse Bettdecke gegen zwei Einzelbettdecken tauschen lassen.

Title: Matrimonio da favola
Text: Io e mio marito siamo andati a visitare la struttura a febbraio del 2020, già all'epoca, nonostante il clima invernale e i lavori in corso, la tenuta ci ha convinti a tal punto da sceglierla come location per il nostro matrimonio. Nonostante le difficoltà causate dal covid, tra cui il rinvio del matrimonio, è andato tutto brillantemente. Durante la degustazione per la scelta del menù, abbiamo scelto le diverse portate, che il giorno del matrimonio ci hanno convinti ancora di più! Personale cordiale, gentile, disponibile (Settimio in particolare). Struttura da favola, i diversi ambienti ( gazebo, sala mediterranea e piscina) uno più bello dell'altro. Cibo di ottima qualità ed ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo..gli ospiti sono rimasti entusiasti. Tutto impeccabile e non da meno il giorno dopo, con percorso benessere e pranzo, gentilmente offerto dalla struttura. Se il nostro giorno è stato meraviglioso e indimenticabile lo dobbiamo al direttore e a tutto lo staff..Ci ritorneremo sicuramente, assolutamente consigliato!!

Title: Da evitare in qualsiasi circostanza. Si vestono eleganti, ma sotto la veste c è orrore.
Text: Purtroppo mal consigliati da amici, ci imbattiamo in questa struttura, che veste eleganza, ma una volta svestita mostra solo orrore. Prenoto una suite, ci danno una stanza di 20 mq appena, con vasca idromassaggio che fa male solo sedendoti, in quanto i fori non avvitati bene tendono a graffiare. Andiamo in piscina, e ci imbattiamo nella maleducazione totale. Danno i posti in piscina a seconda di quanto paghi e soggiorni. Quindi noi dovevamo stare dietro secondo loro insieme alle formiche e sotto il sole con un neonato perché davanti c erano stranieri che si fanno un mese. Ma per favore! Dopo una litigata che ancora i turisti ci guardano.. riusciamo ad ottenere un posto migliore. La sera se hai un bambino e per miracolo sei riuscito a farlo addormentare, devi trovare un percorso tortuoso e diverso dal ingresso principale, stando attento anche  a non essere bagnati dal loro sistema di irrigazione che innaffia sia le piante che la gente che passa, perché ogni sera c è un matrimonio o una festa con parte condivise dagli ospiti che invece si vogliono rilassare.. ristorante e servizio bar da suicidio. Un amaro del capo.. 6 euro. Praticamente gli abbiamo pagato metà bottiglia. Menù al ristorante peggio di una trattoria, con rispetto parlando per la trattoria, con prezzi da cracco. Orecchiette al sugo 10€… n* 2 petto pollo alla contadina 15€… un trancio di salmone piccolissimo 16€… Ringraziando il cielo il mio Salento non è solo questo. Bordo piscina in simpatica compagnia con bambini che camminavano scalzi. Conclusione.. questo è un covo dove spillare soldi ai turisti, ignari e ovviamente con un diverso tenore di vita, dove per loro spendere 5.000€ in una settimana, e non avere servizi adeguati, è normale.

Title: Matrimonio 14/08/2021

Title: Bella ma non balla
Text: Che la location sia bellissima non c’è dubbio. È il resto che lascia a desiderare. Una struttura del genere e a quel prezzo, DEVE mettere a disposizione un facchino. Anche perché tra il parcheggio e la struttura c’è un bel po’ di strada da fare. Vabbè, ci organizziamo e portiamo noi i bagagli. Saliamo in camera (grande) ma poco accogliente. Il bagno, senza finestra, è piuttosto datato. La finestra della camera si trova tra 2 muri e, a malapena, si riesce a scorgere il giardino. Passiamo alla colazione. Essa viene servita in un giardino molto gradevole. Ma la scelta non è da 4 stelle. Qualche cornetto, pasticciotti leccesi rigorosamente surgelati (è come se vado a Napoli e mi danno il babà surgelato) fette biscottate e un paio di torte. Se voglio il salato devo chiederlo. Frittata, prosciutto e formaggio. Niente di più. La ciliegina sulla torta il personale. A parte una ragazza molto simpatica ma che è dedita soprattutto al bar della piscina (che effettivamente è stupenda) il resto del personale sembra snobbarti. Pare che siano lì a farti un favore. Secondo me il posto merita ma, con qualche accortezza in più, sarebbe molto molto meglio. Quindi per me è un NO.

Title: Spettacolare
Text:

Title: Poca professionalità e attenzione per il cliente.
Text:
Sono stato in questa struttura per una sola notte. Premetto che la prenotazione è stata a cura del mio datore di lavoro e che avevo chiamato per sapere fino a che ora fosse aperto il ristorante della struttura. Alla risposta, mi hanno detto che, comunque, avrebbero potuto prepararmi un piatto freddo. Sono arrivato intorno alle 23:30, dopo una lunga riunione ed il ristorante era chiuso. Ho chiesto se fosse possibile darmi un piatto freddo e, in modo sgarbato, mi è stato detto che non era possibile, perché avrei dovuto dirlo prima e perché ora non c’era nessuno in cucina. Sono rimasto molto colpito dalla reazione dello staff di una struttura a 4 stelle che, invece di mettersi a disposizione (ad esempio proporre delle fette biscottate della colazione, del pancarrè con la nutella, insomma qualcosa, qualunque cosa), ha preferito addossare la responsabilità sul cliente. Poca professionalità e poca attenzione. Ma vabbè, passo avanti, mi dico che troverò qualcosa nel frigo bar: impossibile che nella terra dei tarallini non vi sia neanche uno snack, anche solo per far conoscere la cultura gastronomica del territorio. Con mia grandissima sorpresa, invece non solo il frigo era spento e vuoto, ma anche la bottiglia d’acqua messa a disposizione era calda e completamente impolverata.
A parte questo, nella mia stanza ho trovato un palloncino ad elio fluttuante: onestamente non me lo so spiegare, se non con una scarsa attenzione alla pulizia e di per certo non siamo ai dettagli…
Colazione abbastanza scarna, poche alternative salate e anche quelle dolci non erano di ottima fattura, comunque non da 4 stelle…
Al checkout ho fatto presente che anche il frigobar era vuoto e spento, la spiegazione è stata che è una politica della struttura… che dire: chapeau.

P.s. il Salento è una terra accogliente, ma la professionalità è un’altra cosa…

Title: Matrimonio 10 settembre

Title: Servizio scarso. Potrebbero fare di più!
Text:
Premetto che la recensione è lunga e che grazie al servizio del Maitre Davide e Gaetano abbiamo dato 3 punti, altrimenti sarebbero stati meno.
Abbiamo soggiornato a Tenuta Moreno 10 giorni ad agosto con la nostra bimba di 2 anni.

Lati positivi:
- Pulizia camere ottima (quella delle parti comuni un po’ meno), cucina buona a volte molto buona.
- Ottima la formula mezza pensione e la possibilità di decidere se usufruire del pranzo o della cena, avvisando per tempo.
- Il lunedì c’è la serata con degustazione sushi (è necessario prenotarsi prima e c’è un supplemento mi sembra di 20€ per chi ha mezza pensione o pensione completa); noi non l’abbiamo provata.
- Quasi tutti bravi e disponibili i camerieri. Davide e Gaetano sono stati davvero super. La Signora Pina sempre disponibile.
- Parcheggio interno gratuito;
- Wi-Fi gratuito 
- Buono il centro benessere, abbiamo provato due volte i massaggi e ci siamo trovati bene.
- Piscina molto bella, si trovano sempre lettini disponibili e ben distanziati tra loro;
- Sono stati molto gentili e disponibili nella gestione di una spedizione che dove arrivare per noi presso la struttura.
- Ci hanno chiamato il giorno del check out per ricordarci che avevamo dimenticato in camera il nostro cuscino personale.  

Lati negativi:
Mancanza di comunicazione e di informazione al cliente. 
Ad esempio: Il 14 agosto sera, in tenuta, c’era una megacena in occasione della vigilia di ferragosto. Quando il giorno prima abbiamo avvisato in reception che il 14 avremmo usufruito della  mezza pensione a pranzo anziché a cena, nessuno ci ha detto niente. Nessuno ci ha informato che era prevista una cena speciale di ferragosto il 14 sera in struttura. Ce ne siamo accorti al nostro rientro in hotel poco prima della mezzanotte. Vedendo gran festa abbiamo chiesto informazioni e solo in quel momento siamo stati informati. Il bello è che la struttura era al corrente che quel giorno avevamo deciso di fermarci per il pranzo e non per la cena. Credo che queste sono informazioni fondamentali da fornire al cliente! Inoltre quella sera il bar era aperto, ma non c’era nessuno a servire (perché tutti erano impegnati a preparare il gran buffet di dolci di mezzanotte); così sono dovuta andare io a cercare un cameriere al ristorante.
Un altro disservizio: un giorno decidiamo di pranzare in piscina e chiediamo al bagnino, che in quel momento era dietro il bancone,se c’è gentilmente un seggiolone e lui ci risponde che non ci sono seggioloni. Prontamente Gaetano ha risolto trovandoci il seggiolone. Sicuramente il bagnino non sapeva nulla e non doveva trovarsi dietro il bancone del bar in quel momento, ma non si può rispondere così ad un cliente, piuttosto chiedi di attendere l’arrivo del cameriere;
- Tavoli sulla terrazza della piscina sempre sporchi;
- Palestra 24/24: piccolina, ben fornita, ma attrezzi molto vecchi che cigolano. Caldo infernale nella saletta senza aria condizionata.
- Spa: bene i massaggi, ma l’atmosfera ni. Consiglierei di non lasciare sempre attiva la stazione Radio Montecarlo perché quando partono le pubblicità, crolla tutto il relax del massaggio! Anche la luminosità della stanza dovrebbe essere un po’ abbassata. Mi spiace non essere riuscita a segnalare queste due cose.

Durante il soggiorno abbiamo chiesto di parlare con il direttore. Dalla reception ci hanno detto di aver segnalato la nostra richiesta, ma del direttore nessuna traccia.

Nel complesso la struttura è davvero bella con alto potenziale, potrebbe essere una location 5 stelle se prestassero più attenzione ai dettagli. 
Mi piacerebbe ritornare un domani con la speranza che vengano migliorati alcuni difetti.

Title: Misure anticovid nulle!!!
Text: Non so come ad oggi non si utilizzino le misure anticovid. Buffet con invitati che mettono le mani nel cibo, distanze nulle. Occorreva mettere più personale al servizio e si poteva evitare questo scempio!!!

Title: Oasi di pace
Text:
Struttura bellissima, pulitissima, con ampi spazi verdi curati ed una piscina grande e ben curata.
La struttura oggettivamente è eccellente.
Il punto di forza però è il personale.. DANIELA, PERLA, MARTA, DAVIDE, GAETANO, MAURIZIO.. e tutti gli altri! Persone in gamba, di una gentilezza incredibile, professionali ed attenti al cliente tanto che di meglio non potresti chiedere.
La struttura è eccellente ma senza di loro non sarebbe uguale..!

Title: Matrimonio perfetto!!!!!!!
Text:
